content:
Meeting 2021-08-24T17:00:00+02:00

Agenda:

  • Triage (#80357 => #88163, #88175, rust-clippy#7579)
  • Clippy logo rust-clippy#7585
  • ...?
Meeting time :wave:
:wave: :penguin:

So merging #80357 lead to some bugs in Clippy (as expected). I linked the once I know of above. @Cameron Steffen already fixed one, one PR by him is waiting on approval and the last one isn't worked on yet AFAICT.

Any volunteers that can look into rust-clippy#7579? I will probably only get to it after the sync on Thursday.
o/ (I'm outside catching a bus so won't have full bandwidth)

I think the problem of the Rust PR that was merged was that no one from Clippy was pinged to take a last look. So maybe we should tell Rust reviewer that big PRs that change things in subtrees should also get the approval by the team responsible for the subtree
That's all I have to say about this topic, so @triagebot end-topic

Does anyone have something to add on the current topic?
React with :working_on_it: if you have something to say.
React with :all_good: if not.
The next topic would be the logo PR for Clippy. What's the current state of this? We want the proposed logo, but have to verify with the Rust org/foundation that this is ok?
About the Icon, @Manish Goregaokar correctly pointed out that Clippy is now trademarked. See: https://office-watch.com/2021/why-has-microsoft-finally-trademarked-clippy/

The description states:

The mark consists of a drawing of a paperclip with eyeballs and eyebrows intended to look like a face.
Hm, so we're not sure if we are allowed to use this for Clippy?
Correct
Manish Goregaokar also closed rust-clippy#3158 due to this
There's the rust-cippy#7585 now, so I think we still need to figure out if it is allowed.
I personally like the proposed logo.
However, I still like the idea and couldn't we just use a normal paper clip instead of a "paperclip with eyeballs and eyebrows"
It wouldn't be the same :big_smile:
True!!
how about a paperclip with big beefy arms like trogdor
I think I'll do what @Manish Goregaokar suggested and write an email to ask about it. Possibly also to the foundation for legal advice...
That would be awesome. The logo also has a +1 from me

Ok. So to summarize: We like the logo, but have to figure out legal stuff.

That should be it for today then: @triagebot end-meeting

Does anyone have something to bring up?
React with :working_on_it: if you have something to say.
React with :all_good: if you're ready to end the meeting.
@flip1995 yeah you can go ahead and do that
but i'm pretty sure the answer will be no
trademarks don't necessarily mean that the exact image is trademarked
Yeah, that most likely will be the result I guess. Worth the try though.
@xFrednet you got something else? Go ahead!
One question that came up while you where on vacation @flip1995 about sync day. Do we have some documentation how this is done?
Yes: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust-clippy/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#syncing-changes-between-clippy-and-rust-langrust
Ahhh, awesome, I was searching in the docs folder :sweat_smile:
Than we can end the meeting from my side :upside_down:
Yeah, I'm looking forward to the book being merged and extended :)
Great, thanks for attending everyone! :wave:

flip1995 said:

Yeah, I'm looking forward to the book being merged and extended :)

Yes!! I'm also trying to write some documentation about diagnostic items in general for the rustc-dev-guide

flip1995 said:

I think the problem of the Rust PR that was merged was that no one from Clippy was pinged to take a last look. So maybe we should tell Rust reviewer that big PRs that change things in subtrees should also get the approval by the team responsible for the subtree

I am still planning to work on https://github.com/rust-lang/highfive/issues/223 at some point but I haven't gotten around to it yet :(
